column4: hi. in the terminal I can access as normal user an usb device with pmount /dev/sdb1, but If I click in the nautilus on the unmounted usb device, i get an access denied error. Im using feisty fawn... Why I have this problem? It worked with the same configurations on edgy and it worked properly!
I want the usb device to be mounted from  nautilus
as normal user
yes
isnt it mounted when you plug it in? udev rules should mount it ..
Im a network administrator at a school. we're  using ldap and pam for authentication
how to change the label of vfat partitions?
you can mount as normal user with pmount
yep
but only from the terminal not from nautilus
nautilus can mount things? didnt know that :D
yes I know that, but I get an access denied error
you know that i didnt know that nautilus is able to do mounting?
kind of magic
I know that nautilus can mount things, and normally this works fine, but not anymore!
where is the function to mount things? _i_ dont know it
normally devices appear in nautilus when plugged in.. That also happens with my usb-Stick. Now normally you just double-click it and It becomes mounted!
i think its mounted before you can doubleclick it
the mounting is not done by nautilus, its done by the hald and defined in the udev rules as far as i know
no it isnt, I can mount it then from the terminal with pmount and then access it from nautilus, but I must have it mounted just like this.
so the udev rules are messed up
